meanings.definition: Excessive adherence to bureaucratic rules and procedures.
meanings.sent1: The bureaucratism in this office slows down progress.
meanings.sent2: The company's bureaucratism made it difficult to get things done efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The bureaucratism in the government paperwork is like a maze to navigate.
meanings.sent4: The bureaucratism of the system was a tangled web of red tape.
meanings.sent5: The bureaucratism of the school's administration was suffocating.

meanings.definition: The practice or principles of bureaucracy.
meanings.sent1: Understanding bureaucratism is essential in government studies.
meanings.sent2: The book delves into the history of bureaucratism in organizations.
meanings.sent3: The bureaucratism of the city council meetings can be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The bureaucratism of the corporate world can feel like a rigid hierarchy.
meanings.sent5: The bureaucratism of the legal system can be overwhelming.
